pages.text: Haplophrentis is a small, shelled creature from the Cambrian of the modern northern American continent. It lived in association with many other well-known Cambrian animals of the Greater Phyllopod Bed and Burgess Shale. It was not a very common member of the communities there. It was a small creature up to around 4.5cm long, and is possibly related to brachiopods or other molluscs.

It was a small creature up to around 4.5cm long, and is possibly related to brachiopods or other molluscs. It was a filter feeder and possessed arm-like structures which could be used to elevate the shell opening diagonally, and perhaps also used to push the creature around on the sea-floor. Its name means "single wall", in reference to the shell possessing only a single wall inside it.
